meanings.definition: A person receiving instruction in the principles of Christianity before baptism.
meanings.sent1: The catechumens eagerly listened to the teachings of the priest.
meanings.sent2: The catechumens gathered every Sunday to learn about Christianity.
meanings.sent3: The catechumens joked about having to memorize so many Bible verses.
meanings.sent4: The group of catechumens were like sponges, absorbing all the religious knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The image of the catechumens studying under the church's roof will forever stay with me.

meanings.definition: Plural form of catechumen, referring to a group of individuals undergoing religious instruction.
meanings.sent1: The catechumens were excited to explore the teachings of Christianity together.
meanings.sent2: In the church, the catechumens formed a close-knit community.
meanings.sent3: During the lesson, the catechumens playfully debated the meaning of baptism.
meanings.sent4: The room echoed with the voices of the catechumens as they discussed their faith.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the catechumens walking towards the chapel symbolized their spiritual journey.
